scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible customer churn prediction model using a model inversion attack. The attacker aims to identify high-value customers based on predicted churn probability, targeting them for phishing or other malicious activities.
initial_goal: Analyze the publicly available customer churn prediction API to identify patterns and potentially infer sensitive customer data.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: The churn prediction model is a publicly accessible API offered by a bank to third-party developers for integration into financial management apps.  The model is trained on anonymized customer data but still contains implicit correlations that can be exploited.
